posts.title: Envision: Creativity Meets Implementation
posts.description: Envision is the blend of creativity and implementation â€” an event to explore real-world problems, build impactful solutions, and present them to a live audience. Participants will progress through problem selection, ideation, prototyping, and final deployment, developing solutions with real-time impact. The competition focuses on innovation, feasibility, and technical implementation.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Team Size: 1 to 4 members (excluding the team leader).
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ No Plagiarism: Copy-pasting projects from GitHub or any other sources will lead to immediate disqualification.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Formal attire is mandatory during all screening rounds.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Fair Play & Team Spirit: Any form of misconduct or unfair practice will lead to disqualification.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Judges' verdict will be final and binding.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Screening Rounds: (1) PPT Submission â€“ Problem statement, proposed idea, targeted users, and expected impact. (2) Basic Prototype â€“ Showcase a partially working solution demonstrating feasibility. (3) Final Prototype â€“ Present a fully developed project with real-time applications.
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ Finalist teams will present their projects during the Bits-2-Bytes Grand Finale.

posts.title: Electronovation: Hardware Innovation Challenge
posts.description: ELECTRONOVATION 2K25 is a hardware innovation competition where student teams build and showcase real-world tech solutions integrating hardware and software (e.g., Arduino, IoT, robotics). Teams will progress through multiple screening stages, demonstrating creativity, functionality, and real-world impact in their prototypes.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Each team must consist of 3 to 6 students.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Open to all branches and years â€” interdisciplinary teams encouraged.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ One project per team; solo entries are not allowed.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ All members must contribute to both hardware and software development.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Projects must include a working hardware + software setup; no pure simulations allowed.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Teams must bring their own safe, self-powered setup; no hazardous or high-voltage components.
rules.rule8: ğŸ“ Screening stages: (1) PPT Submission, (2) 60% Prototype Demo, (3) 90% Model Review.
rules.rule9: ğŸ“ Judging criteria: Innovation, integration, complexity, functionality, impact, presentation, and teamwork.
rules.rule10: ğŸ“ Only original work is allowed; plagiarized or unsafe projects will be disqualified.
rules.rule11: ğŸ“ Teams are responsible for setup, demo, and time management.
rules.rule12: ğŸ“ Judges decision will be final and binding.

posts.title: Cosmic Contour: Basic Science Project Challenge
posts.description: COSMIC CONTOUR is a Basic Science project competition designed to test analytical and scientific problem-solving skills. Participants must create innovative hardware projects based purely on basic science concepts â€” no microcontrollers allowed. The event challenges creativity, originality, and practical application of science, promising an exciting and knowledge-driven experience.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Teams must consist of 3 to 4 members, with one designated leader to coordinate and represent the team.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Teams must select a unique and original project idea; no two teams can present identical concepts.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Projects must strictly be based on basic science concepts; use of any microcontroller or advanced electronics is not allowed.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Teams must showcase their project onsite during the Tech Fest, demonstrating innovation and practical application.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Judging criteria include innovation, integration, complexity, functionality, impact, presentation, and teamwork.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Judging will be conducted by an external panel, and all decisions will be final and non-negotiable.

posts.title: GenFusion: Innovate, Integrate, Impact
posts.description: GenFusion is where innovation meets intelligence â€” a platform to explore real-world domains, build impactful solutions, and fuse ambition with algorithms. Participants will progress through ideation, prototyping, and final deployment, developing solutions that create real-time impact. The event features multiple screening rounds evaluating creativity, technical skills, and practicality.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Team Size: 1 to 4 members (excluding the team leader).
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Only the team leader will be added to the official WhatsApp group.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Formal attire is mandatory for all participants during presentations.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Misconduct or indiscipline will lead to immediate disqualification.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Judges' verdict will be final and binding.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ The organizing committee reserves the right to modify rules if required; participants will be informed in such cases.
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ Screening Rounds: (1) PPT Submission â€“ Problem statement, proposed idea, targeted users, and expected impact. (2) Basic Prototype â€“ Showcase a partially working solution demonstrating feasibility. (3) Final Prototype â€“ Present a fully developed project with real-time applications.
rules.rule8: ğŸ“ Finalist teams will present their projects during the Bits 2 Bytes grand finale.

posts.title: Return Zero: Ready. Set. Innovate.
posts.description: RETURN ZERO is a 5-hour offline team event where creativity meets execution. It's not your usual hackathon â€” no chaos, no overnight marathons. Just brainstorm, build, and showcase your idea-driven prototype in a chill, energetic environment. Whether you code, design, or ideate â€” there's a role for you.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Duration: The event will run for exactly 5 hours. No extensions allowed.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Team Size: Each team must have 3 to 4 members, all from the same college.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Registration: Only the Team Leader needs to register on behalf of the team and will be the main point of contact.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Onsite Presence: All team members must be physically present at the event venue (BIT Main Building) throughout the event.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Originality: No pre-written code or prior submissions are allowed. All work must be done during the event.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Fair Play: Strictly no plagiarism or unfair practices. Any misconduct will lead to immediate disqualification.
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ One Team Only: Participants can register with only one team â€” no cross-team involvement.
rules.rule8: ğŸ“ College ID: All participants must carry their valid college ID cards for verification at the venue.
rules.rule9: ğŸ“ Final Decision: Judging will be done by an external panel, and all results will be final and non-negotiable.

posts.title: ZeroDayCTF
posts.description: ZeroDayCTF is a fast-paced, online hacking competition where you solve puzzles, break into systems, and find hidden 'flags' to earn points â€” like a digital treasure hunt for hackers. Challenges span web hacking, reverse engineering, cryptography, forensics, binary exploitation, and OSINT. Whether you're a beginner or a pro, ZeroDayCTF offers quick wins, brain-teasing challenges, and real-world hacking experience. Compete solo or in teams, learn hands-on, and climb the leaderboard as curiosity meets competition.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Hack only the systems and challenges provided â€” stay within the scope.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ No cheating, answer sharing, or use of unauthorized tools.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Be respectful to other participants and maintain sportsmanship.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Keep everything safe, legal, and fun â€” ethical hacking only.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Breaking any rule may result in disqualification.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Full detailed rules will be posted on the day of the event.

posts.title: Predicto Code
posts.content: Are you ready to test your Coding Skills with hardened Battle Coding Competition ? Test your DSA skills, race against the clock, and climb to the top of the leaderboard!
posts.description: Predict-O-Code is a 1 hour 30 minute solo coding contest hosted on HackerRank, featuring 5 data structures and algorithms (DSA) problems of increasing difficultyâ€”from easy to hard.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“No marks for printing expected outputsâ€”only valid solutions are considered.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Partial scores are awarded only for near-optimal solutions that result in TLE.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Faster correct submissions are ranked higher, so time matters.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Individual participation onlyâ€”no teams allowed.

posts.title: Code Ardor
posts.description: ğŸš€ Code Ardor is the ultimate MCQ-based coding challenge to test your programming logic, syntax, and problem-solving skills. Tackle 20 multiple-choice questions covering C, C++, Java, JavaScript, and Python. Compete in a high-speed coding sprint, race through the leaderboard, and prove your coding prowess. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned coder, Code Ardor promises a thrilling tech experience where speed meets accuracy. ğŸ§  Think Fast. Code Smart. Compete Boldly.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Participants can attempt MCQs from C, C++, Java, JavaScript, and Python.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ It's a fast-paced, first-come-first-serve challenge â€” be quick and accurate.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ No internet access or external help is allowed during the contest.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Individual participation only; team entries are not permitted.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Top scorers with the fastest submissions will be declared winners.

posts.title: Robo Soccer
posts.content: Embark to the ultimate Journey of Soccer adventure
posts.description: Robo Soccer is an electrifying event where two ğŸ¤– bots (car-like) compete in a thrilling âš½ football match. Each bot is remotely controlled by a human ğŸ®, demanding sharp focus and swift moves. Players guide their bots to dribble, defend, and score goals just like real soccer stars. The field turns into a battleground of speed, precision, and smart strategies. Get ready for non-stop action, roaring goals, and robotic rivalry ğŸ¤–âš¡âš½!

rules.rule1: ğŸ“Team can have a maximum of FOUR members and a minimum of THREE members.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Only ONE participant should control the robot. No player can change in the middle of the match.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ A robot can PUSH or HIT the ball. It cannot grab or withhold the ball.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ If the ball is blocked for more than 1 minute by the robots, the positions of the ball and both robots may be adjusted by the Organizers.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Human interference (e.g., touching the robot) during the game is not allowed.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Decisions of the Judges and Event Organizers shall be treated as final and binding on all and cannot be contested.
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ The Event Coordinator is the Match Referee. HE/SHE takes all the decisions and participants have to abide by it.
rules.rule8: ğŸ“ Coordinators reserve the right to ask for an explanation of the robot.
rules.rule9: ğŸ“ The coordinator can change the rules of the game depending on the situation.
rules.rule10: ğŸ“ Rules & Regulations may change without prior notice by the Event Organizers.
rules.rule11: ğŸ“ Match Details & Match Fixtures will be updated only in the Event WhatsApp Group.

posts.title: Robo Rally
posts.content: Come and participate in the Robo Rally the ultimate race between machines and minds
posts.description: Welcome to Robo Rally ğŸ¤– â€” the ultimate race begins where machines race and minds compete. Dodge obstacles, beat your rivals, and own the track.   Only sharp reflexes and fast moves keep you ahead. Get ready to grab the winning tag! ğŸ

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Team size : 3 to 4 (All members must from same institute)
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ The team that takes the lowest time to complete the track will win.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ If any part of the race track is skipped, a certain time will be added to the competing time. The time will be decided based on the situation by the coordinators.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Only ONE participant should control the robot. No player can be exchanged in the middle of a game.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Goal kicks to be taken anywhere inside penalty area. Opposition must be 3 metres away and ball must leave penalty area for play to recommended.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Human interference (e.g., touching the robot) during the game is not allowed.
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ Before the game, the bot specifications may be checked. If they do not match the game criteria, the coordinators can disqualify the team.
rules.rule8: ğŸ“ Decisions of the Judges and Event Organizers shall be treated as final and binding on all and cannot be contested.
rules.rule9: ğŸ“ The Event Coordinator is the judge. HE/SHE takes all the decisions and participants have to abide by them.
rules.rule10: ğŸ“ Coordinators reserve the right to ask for an explanation of the robot.
rules.rule11: ğŸ“ The coordinator can change the rules of the game depending on the situation.
rules.rule12: ğŸ“ Rules and regulations may change without prior notice, at the discretion of the Event Organizers.

posts.title: Quad X
posts.description: Looking for an exciting and futuristic way to showcase your skills and compete against other racing enthusiasts? ğŸš—Look no further than the Robo Race Game Competition! ğŸ®

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Students belonging to 11th/12th/Degree/Diploma/B.Tech can participate.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Each participant should carry their respective Student Identity Proof.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ If participants car get un-routed, then they will get only three chances to reroute.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ The track provided will include various obstacles on route and the  car completing the track in the shortest amount of time will be the winner.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ A team can comprise 1-2 people.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Rules are subject to change depending on the degree of participation.
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ The Committee's decision shall be final.

posts.title: QuizScript
posts.description: Welcome to QuizScript, the exclusive quiz contest of the Tech Fest at Bengal Institute of Technology, where brilliance meets pressure and quick thinking leads to triumph! Step into a world of mind-boggling questions, competitive spirit, and electrifying moments as you and your teammate tackle twists and turns across every round. QuizScript isn't just a game â€” it's a battle of intellect, composure, and speed.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Preliminary Round: Participants enter in pairs and face off in a thrilling quiz showdown.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ The Top 20 teams from the leaderboard qualify for the Semi-Final and Final rounds.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ The Grand Quizmaster will lead each round, announcing questions and enforcing event rules.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Only the Top 3 teams on the final leaderboard will emerge as champions of QuizScript.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Teams must maintain fair play and follow the Quizmaster's instructions strictly.

posts.title: Math Pirates
posts.description: ğŸ´â€â˜  Math Pirates is a fun and exciting event where students solve different types of math problems in a creative way. Just like pirates hunting for treasure, participants will go on a journey full of brain-teasing puzzles, quick calculations, and logic-based questions. It's not just about speed â€” it's about smart thinking, teamwork, and enjoying the thrill of problem-solving. Whether you're great at math or simply love challenges, Math Pirates is a fun way to learn and boost your confidence in mathematics.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Math Pirates is a part of the upcoming Techfest.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ The event will begin with a Prelims Round consisting of aptitude-based questions.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Each participant must individually attempt the prelims.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Qualified participants will be grouped into teams of two for the final rounds.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ These two-member teams will compete in the Final Event.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ The quiz will consist of multiple rounds testing logical, mathematical, and problem-solving skills.
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ Based on performance in the main event, the top three teams will be declared 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place winners.

posts.title: Electrobox: The Ultimate Circuit Quiz
posts.description: âš¡ğŸ’« ELECTROBOX is a circuit quiz event designed to test your knowledge in the field of circuits. It is an opportunity to put your analytical and problem-solving skills to the test. The event promises to be an exciting one, with challenging questions that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Round 1: MCQ questions on Basic Electrical, Analog & Digital Electronics concepts will be asked.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Round 2: A pair consisting of a 2nd-year and a 3rd-year student will be formed from participants qualifying for this round.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ The selected pair will be asked to make a simple circuit.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ The pair completing the fastest and most accurate circuit will be announced as the winner.

posts.title: Debate Competition
posts.description: The Debate Competition is a platform to voice opinions, challenge ideas, and enhance the power of persuasion. It encourages students to engage in intellectual discourse on relevant and thought-provoking topics, promoting respectful argumentation, confidence, and logical reasoning.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Team Composition: Each team must consist of 2 members â€” one speaking for and one against the motion.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Eligibility: Open to all college students with valid ID cards.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Topic & Preparation: Topics will be given 1 day prior to the debate. Internet usage is allowed only during the preparation phase.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Speaking Time: Each participant gets 2 minutes to present their points. A 1-minute rebuttal round will follow after both participants speak.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Language: The medium of debate will be English.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Judging Criteria: Content â€“ 40%, Delivery & Confidence â€“ 20%, Relevance & Structure â€“ 20%, Rebuttal & Presence of Mind â€“ 20%.
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ Conduct Guidelines: No offensive or disrespectful language. Personal attacks will lead to immediate disqualification. Maintain decorum throughout the event.
rules.rule8: ğŸ“ Time Warnings: A warning bell will be rung at the last 30 seconds. Exceeding time limits may result in deduction of marks.
rules.rule9: ğŸ“ Final Decision: The decision of the judges is final and binding.

posts.title: LEN-S-URGE
posts.description: LEN-S-URGE is the official photography competition of BITS-2-BYTES 2K25, designed to ignite the creative spirit of photography enthusiasts. The name blends 'Lens' and 'Surge', symbolizing a powerful rise of visual storytelling through the camera lens. Whether you're a casual shooter or a passionate visual artist, LEN-S-URGE is a platform to express emotions, perspectives, and untold stories. With carefully curated themes and a space for originality, it's more than a contest â€” it's a celebration of how you see the world.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Unique Entry: One photo can only be entered one time.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Entry Limit: Each participant can submit a minimum of 2 images or a maximum of 4 images as per theme. Submitting both themes is not mandatory.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Online Submission: All entries must be submitted via the official form.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ File Format: All images must be in JPEG format.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ File Size: Image file size must not exceed 7 MB.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Image Naming: Each image must have a proper name (no numbers). Use the format: 'Participant's Name_Theme_Title' (e.g., 'Ashok Chakraborty_Shadow & Reflection_What lies beneath the reflection?').
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ No watermark or signature: Images must not contain any signature, name, or watermark.
rules.rule9: ğŸ“ AI-Generated or Captured Images: Images can be either AI-generated or captured by the participants.
rules.rule10: ğŸ“ Editing Guidelines: Minor editing like dust/noise removal and cropping is allowed.
rules.rule11: ğŸ“ Original Raw File: Judges may request the original raw photo if necessary.

posts.title: Scientific Poster Presentation
posts.description: The Scientific Poster Presentation is an academic event encouraging students and researchers to showcase innovative scientific ideas, experimental findings, or literature reviews in a visually engaging format. Participants will summarize their research or concepts in science, engineering, or technology, promoting scientific thinking, improving communication skills, and sparking creativity by presenting complex ideas in a concise and visually attractive way.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Participation can be individual or in teams of up to 2 members.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Poster size must be A1 (594mm x 841mm) or 36" x 48".
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Posters must strictly follow the official template provided by the event coordinator.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Posters should use clear headings, bullet points, and visuals such as graphs, tables, and images.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Text should be minimal and legible from a distance (recommended font size: â‰¥ 18 pt).
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ Use high-resolution images and maintain good contrast for maximum readability.
rules.rule7: ğŸ“ Each participant/team will get 5â€“7 minutes to present their poster to the judges.
rules.rule8: ğŸ“ A Q&A session of 2â€“3 minutes will follow each presentation.

posts.title: Satyanweshi: Campus Of Cipers
posts.description: Satyanweshi - The Ultimate Detective Hunt is a thrilling mystery-solving event where logic, instinct, and observation take the spotlight. Participants will face mind-bending riddles, physical challenges, and unexpected twists as they journey through a carefully crafted storyline. Set against the backdrop of intrigue and secrets, this event tests not just intelligence â€” but presence of mind under pressure.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Each team must consist of 3 members.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Choose a unique team name â€” let it speak for your spirit.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Punctuality is essential â€” delays may cost you more than time.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Rules for each round will be disclosed as you progress. Pay attention to the game host's instructions for each new stage.
rules.rule5: ğŸ“ Any damage or violation of the game environment or rules may result in disqualification.
rules.rule6: ğŸ“ No external devices, mobile phones, or outside assistance. Use only the clues and tools provided within the game environment

posts.title: BGMI
posts.description: BGMI - Battlegrounds Mobile India is a thrilling online multiplayer battle royale game that tests your strategic thinking, teamwork, and reflexes. Players will engage in intense combat scenarios, utilizing a variety of weapons and tactics to outsmart their opponents. Set in a dynamic and immersive environment, this event challenges not only your gaming skills but also your ability to adapt and thrive under pressure.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Team Size: Each team must consist of exactly 4 players (squad mode).
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Device Requirement: Players must use their own mobile devices with BGMI installed and updated to the latest version.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Fair Play: Use of any hacks, cheats, or third-party software will result in immediate disqualification.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Match Format: Tournament will follow knockout/elimination rounds with custom room matches organized by coordinators.

posts.title: Free Fire
posts.description: Free Fire is a thrilling online multiplayer battle royale game that tests your strategic thinking, teamwork, and reflexes. Players will engage in intense combat scenarios, utilizing a variety of weapons and tactics to outsmart their opponents. Set in a dynamic and immersive environment, this event challenges not only your gaming skills but also your ability to adapt and thrive under pressure.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Team Size: Each team must consist of exactly 4 players (squad mode).
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Device Requirement: Players must use their own mobile devices with Free Fire installed and updated to the latest version.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Fair Play: Use of any hacks, cheats, or third-party software will result in immediate disqualification.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Match Format: Tournament will follow elimination rounds with custom room matches organized by coordinators.

posts.title: VALORANT
posts.description: VALORANT is a thrilling online multiplayer first-person shooter game that tests your strategic thinking, teamwork, and reflexes. Players will engage in intense combat scenarios, utilizing a variety of weapons and tactics to outsmart their opponents. Set in a dynamic and immersive environment, this event challenges not only your gaming skills but also your ability to adapt and thrive under pressure.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Team Size: Each team must consist of exactly 5 players.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Device Requirement: Players must use their own PC/laptop with VALORANT installed and updated to the latest version.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Fair Play: Use of any hacks, cheats, or third-party software will result in immediate disqualification.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Match Format: Tournament will follow standard competitive format with best-of-3 elimination rounds.

posts.title: FIFA
posts.description: FIFA is a thrilling online multiplayer football simulation game that tests your strategic thinking, teamwork, and reflexes. Players will engage in intense matches, utilizing a variety of tactics and skills to outsmart their opponents. Set in a dynamic and immersive environment, this event challenges not only your gaming skills but also your ability to adapt and thrive under pressure.

rules.rule1: ğŸ“ Individual Participation: This is a solo tournament with one player per match.
rules.rule2: ğŸ“ Device Requirement: Players must use their own PC/console with FIFA installed and updated to the latest version.
rules.rule3: ğŸ“ Fair Play: Use of any external controllers or unfair advantages will result in immediate disqualification.
rules.rule4: ğŸ“ Match Format: Tournament will follow knockout elimination rounds with 6-minute halves per match.

posts.title: Web Development
posts.description: Web Development is a crucial skill in today's digital age, encompassing the creation and maintenance of websites. This event will cover various aspects of web development, including front-end and back-end technologies, design principles, and best practices.

posts.title: Robo Rally workshop
posts.description: Robo Rally is an exciting robotics competition that challenges participants to design, build, and program their own robots to navigate a complex course. This event promotes creativity, problem-solving, and teamwork as participants work together to overcome obstacles and complete tasks.
